meanings.definition: Of or relating to the depths of the ocean.
meanings.sent1: The abyssal creatures live in the dark depths of the sea.
meanings.sent2: The submarine explored the abyssal region of the ocean floor.
meanings.sent3: The abyssal fish threw a party at the ocean's deepest point.
meanings.sent4: Her eyes held an abyssal mystery that captivated all who gazed into them.
meanings.sent5: The abyssal pressure at the ocean's bottom is immense and unforgiving.

meanings.sent1: His abyssal thoughts kept him awake at night.
meanings.sent2: The poet's words had an abyssal impact on the audience.
meanings.sent3: The abyssal silence in the room made everyone uncomfortable.
meanings.sent4: Her love for him was as abyssal as the ocean's depths.
meanings.sent5: The abyssal emotions he felt overwhelmed him completely.

meanings.sent1: The adventurer peered into the abyssal and felt a chill run down his spine.
meanings.sent2: Legends speak of an abyssal that swallows all who dare to approach.
meanings.sent3: The abyssal in the story was actually a portal to another world.
meanings.sent4: His guilt felt like an abyssal that he could never climb out of.
meanings.sent5: The abyssal in his mind seemed to grow darker with each passing day.
